Column Comment.0: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.1: LOCATION TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of obj ect being given a legallocation. For example, node, well, ...
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.5: AREA TYPE: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, county, district,province, state, city, geographic, geologic etc.
Column Comment.6: BLOCK ADDITION: Alpha prefix to the block number ("A" in OCS addition areas).
Column Comment.7: BLOCK MODIFIER: Alpha character suffix on the block number distinguishing it fromothers in the same area.
Column Comment.8: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.10: EAST/WEST FOOTAGE: Distance measured, from a east or west reference line tothe well location (e.g., 660FEL).
Column Comment.11: EAST/WEST FOOTAGE OUOM: East/West footage original unit of measure.
Column Comment.12: EAST-WEST START LINE: The east-west starting lines for offset distances. Thesedescriptions are used primarily for non-orthonormal survey blocks such as Texassurveys and California blocks. For example, entries could be FEL (first east line),NEL (northmost east line),...
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.14: FOOTAGE ORIGIN: The point of origin used in measuring the survey footage calls toa well location.
Column Comment.15: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.16: EAST-WEST DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid East-West directions.For example, East, West.
Column Comment.17: NORTH-SOUTH DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid north-southDirections. For example, North, South.
Column Comment.18: GRID BLOCK RANGE: Number identifying the block increasing east or west of theprincipal meridian.
Column Comment.19: GRID BLOCK TIER: Number identifying the block increasing north or south of thebaseline.
Column Comment.20: NORTH/SOUTH FOOTAGE: Distance measured from a north or south reference lineto the well location (e.g., 660FNL).
Column Comment.21: NORTH/SOUTH FOOTAGE OUOM: North/South footage original unit of measure.
Column Comment.22: NORTH-SOUTH START LINE: The north-south starting lines for offset distances.These descriptions are used primarily for non-orthonormal survey blocks such asTexas surveys and California blocks. For example, entries could be FSL (first southline), ESL (eastmost south line), ...
Column Comment.23: OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF NUMBER: Number assigned to all offshore wells inFederal territory, on the Outer Continental Shelf .
Column Comment.24: OFFSHORE AREA CODE: The offshore area code used for US offshore welllocations.
Column Comment.25: OFFSHORE BLOCK: Number identifying the offshore oil and gas concession areadefined by its longitude and latitude, a subdivision of an OCS area.
Column Comment.26: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.27: PROJECTED EAST-WEST DIRECTION: Entries in this column identify validEast-West directions. For example, East, West.
Column Comment.28: PRINICPAL MERIDIAN CODE: A reference table identifying the valid principalmeridians used for legal survey descriptions. This is the f irst meridian in the surveyfrom which all other meridians are numbere d. For example Black Hi lls1878, Boise1867, Chicksaw 1833, ...
Column Comment.29: PROJECTED NORTH-SOUTH DIRECTION: A reference table identifying validnorth-south Directions. For example, North, South.
Column Comment.30: PROJECTED RANGE: Number designating a whole or partial range division east orwest of the principal meridian. The projected "congressional" attributes are used forUS state waters which are located in the offshore area ( Legal_Offshore_Loc) table.The data is reported as projected township/range/section location data on theregulatory forms.
Column Comment.31: PROJECTED SECTION: Number designating the section within a township, 1-36.These projected "congressional" attributes are used for US state waters which arelocated in the offshore area ( Legal_Offshore_Loc) table. The data is reportedasprojected township/range/section location data on the regulatory forms.
Column Comment.32: PROJECTED TOWNSHIP: Number designating the township division north or southof the baseline. These projected "congressional" attributes are used for US statewaters which are located in the offshore area ( Legal_Offshore_Loc) table. The datais reported as projected township/range/section location data on the regulatory forms.
Column Comment.33: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.34: SCALED FOOTAGE INDICATOR: A yes / no flag indicating that the operator filedpermit/plat well location footage is different from the clients interpreted mappedfootage. In this case, the clients well location footage is indicated as scaled footage.
Column Comment.35: UTM QUADRANT: Number identifying the alpha UTM quadrant, UTM zone number,and UTM numeric quadrant (e.g., NG15-2).
Column Comment.36: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.37: WATER BOTTOM ZONE: The water bottom zone. This code is retained in Louisianaas special allowable area or zone.
Column Comment.38: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)
Column Comment.39: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.40: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.41: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.42: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.43: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.44: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.45: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
